The type of item associated with the AutoComplete.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.AutoCompleteEvents`2.OnActionBegin
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before fetching data from the data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.AutoCompleteEvents`2.OnActionComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets the evnet callback that will be invoked after data is fetched sucaction from the data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.AutoCompleteEvents`2.OnActionFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the data fetch request fails.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.AutoCompleteEvents`2.OnOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the suggestions popup before it opens
member.remarks: Prevent the suggestions popup open action using .

example.code:
<SfAutoComplete TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <AutoCompleteEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" OnOpen="@OnOpenHandler"/>
            </SfAutoComplete>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnOpenHandler(BeforeOpenEventArgs args) {
                    args.Cancel = true;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.AutoCompleteEvents`2.Blur
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the AutoComplete component loses focus.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.AutoCompleteEvents`2.ValueChange
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the property changed.
member.remarks: This event triggers when an item in a popup is selected or when the user changes the model value.

example.code:
<SfAutoComplete TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <AutoCompleteEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" ValueChange="@OnChange"/>
            </SfAutoComplete>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnChange(Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ChangeEventArgs<string, string> args) {
                    var NewValue = args.Value;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.AutoCompleteEvents`2.OnClose
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before the suggestions popup is closed.
member.remarks: Prevent the suggestions popup close action using and the popup remains opened always.

example.code:
<SfAutoComplete TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <AutoCompleteEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" OnClose="@OnCloseHandler"/>
            </SfAutoComplete>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnCloseHandler(PopupEventArgs args) {
                    args.Cancel = true;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.AutoCompleteEvents`2.Filtering
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked on typing a character in the AutoComplete.
member.remarks: Prevent the default filter action and make your query enable the event argument, and pass the modified data source and query in the method.

example.code:
<SfAutoComplete @ref="AutoCompleteObj" TItem="string" TValue="string" AllowFiltering="true" DataSource="@MyList">
                <AutoCompleteEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" Filtering="@OnFilteringHandler" />
            </SfAutoComplete>
            @code{
                SfAutoComplete<string, string> AutoCompleteObj { get; set; }
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public async Task OnFilteringHandler(FilteringEventArgs args) {
                    args.PreventDefaultAction = true;
                    var query = new Query().Where(new WhereFilter() { Field = "Text", Operator = "contains", value = args.Text, IgnoreCase = true });
                    await AutoCompleteObj.FilterAsync(MyList, query);
                }
              }

member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the component is the focus.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.AutoCompleteEvents`2.OnValueSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when an item is selected from the suggestions popup by the user either with a mouse tap or with a keyboard navigation.
member.remarks: Prevent the item selection action using .

example.code:
<SfAutoComplete TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <AutoCompleteEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" OnValueSelect="@OnSelectHandler" />
            </SfAutoComplete>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnSelectHandler(SelectEventArgs<string> args) {
                    if(args.ItemData== "Medium")
                        args.Cancel = true;
                }
              }

member.summary: Update the disable class and disable attributes in a ListOptions object.
member.param: The ListOptions object that represents the list item to be disabled.
member.remarks: This method modifies the ListClass property of the ListOptions object by adding the DISABLED_ITEM class. It also sets the "aria-selected" attribute to "false" and the "aria-disabled" attribute to "true" in the ListAttribute dictionary of the ListOptions object. If the ListAttribute dictionary is null, it initializes a new dictionary before setting the attributes.

member.summary: Represents the event handlers for a ComboBox component in the Blazor framework.

The type of item associated with the ComboBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.OnActionBegin
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before fetching data from the data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.OnActionComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked after data is fetched suction from the data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.OnActionFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the data fetch request fails.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.OnOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the dropdown popup before it opens.
member.remarks: Prevent the dropdown popup open action using .

example.code:
<SfComboBox TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <ComboBoxEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" OnOpen="@OnOpenHandler"/>
            </SfComboBox>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnOpenHandler(BeforeOpenEventArgs args) {
                    args.Cancel = true;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.Blur
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the ComboBox component loses focus.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.ValueChange
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the property changed.
member.remarks: This event triggers when an item in a popup is selected or when the user changes the model value.

example.code:
<SfComboBox TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <ComboBoxEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" ValueChange="@OnChange"/>
            </SfComboBox>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnChange(Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ChangeEventArgs<string, string> args) {
                    var NewValue = args.Value;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.OnClose
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before the dropdown popup is closed.
member.remarks: Prevent the dropdown popup close action using and the popup remains opened always.

example.code:
<SfComboBox TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <ComboBoxEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" OnClose="@OnCloseHandler"/>
            </SfComboBox>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnCloseHandler(PopupEventArgs args) {
                    args.Cancel = true;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.Created
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the component is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.CustomValueSpecifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when custom values (not present in the data source) are selected in the ComboBox component.

example.code:
<SfComboBox TValue="int" TItem="Countries" DataSource="@CountryList">
               <ComboBoxEvents TValue="int" TItem="Countries" CustomValueSpecifier="@customValue"></ComboBoxEvents>
               <ComboBoxFieldSettings Text="Name" Value="Code"></ComboBoxFieldSettings>
            </SfComboBox>
            @code{
                public class Countries {
                    public string Name { get; set; }
                    public int Code { get; set; }
                }
                private List<Countries> CountryList = new List<Countries>() {
                    new Countries(){ Code= 101, Name= "Australia" },
                    new Countries(){ Code= 102, Name= "Canada" }
                 }
                private void customValue(CustomValueSpecifierEventArgs<Countries> args) {
                    args.Item = new Countries() { Code = 103, Name = args.Text };
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.DataBound
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the data source is populated in the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.Destroyed
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the component is destroyed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.Filtering
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked on typing a character in the ComboBox.
member.remarks: Prevent the default filter action and make your query enable the event argument, and pass the modified data source and query in the method.

example.code:
<SfComboBox @ref="ComboBoxObj" TItem="string" TValue="string" AllowFiltering="true" DataSource="@MyList">
                <ComboBoxEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" Filtering="@OnFilteringHandler" />
            </SfComboBox>
            @code{
                SfComboBox<string, string> ComboBoxObj { get; set; }
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public async Task OnFilteringHandler(FilteringEventArgs args) {
                    args.PreventDefaultAction = true;
                    var query = new Query().Where(new WhereFilter() { Field = "Text", Operator = "contains", value = args.Text, IgnoreCase = true });
                    await ComboBoxObj.FilterAsync(MyList, query);
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.Focus
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the component is the focus.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.Opened
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the dropdown popup opens.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.Closed
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked after the dropdown popup has been closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.OnValueSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when an item is selected from the dropdown popup by the user either with a mouse tap or with a keyboard navigation.
member.remarks: Prevent the item selection action using .

example.code:
<SfComboBox TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <ComboBoxEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" OnValueSelect="@OnSelectHandler" />
            </SfComboBox>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnSelectHandler(SelectEventArgs<string> args) {
                    if(args.ItemData== "Medium")
                        args.Cancel = true;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2.OnOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the dropdown popup before opens.
member.remarks: You can prevent the dropdown popup open action using .

example.code:
<SfDropDownList TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <DropDownListEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" OnOpen="@OnOpenHandler"/>
            </SfDropDownList>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnOpenHandler(BeforeOpenEventArgs args) {
                    args.Cancel = true;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2.Blur
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the dropdown list loses focus.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2.ValueChange
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the property changed.
member.remarks: This event triggers when an item in a popup is selected or when the model value is changed by user.

example.code:
<SfDropDownList TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <DropDownListEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" ValueChange="@OnChange"/>
            </SfDropDownList>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnChange(Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ChangeEventArgs<string, string> args) {
                    var DDLValue = args.Value;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2.OnClose
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before the dropdown popup is close.
member.remarks: You can prevent the dropdown popup close action using and the popup remains opened always.

example.code:
<SfDropDownList TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <DropDownListEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" OnClose="@OnCloseHandler"/>
            </SfDropDownList>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnCloseHandler(PopupEventArgs args) {
                    args.Cancel = true;
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2.Filtering
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked on typing a character in the filter textbox.
member.remarks: You can prevent the default filter action and make your query enable the event argument, and pass the modify data source and query in method.

example.code:
<SfDropDownList @ref="DDLObj" TItem="string" TValue="string" AllowFiltering="true" DataSource="@MyList">
                <DropDownListEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" Filtering="@OnFilteringHandler" />
            </SfDropDownList>
            @code{
                SfDropDownList<string, string> DDLObj { get; set; }
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public async Task OnFilteringHandler(FilteringEventArgs args) {
                    args.PreventDefaultAction = true;
                    var query = new Query().Where(new WhereFilter() { Field = "Text", Operator = "contains", value = args.Text, IgnoreCase = true });
                    await DDLObj.FilterAsync(MyList, query);
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2.OnValueSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be when an item is selected from the dropdown popup by the user either with mouse/tap or with keyboard navigation.
member.remarks: You can prevent the item selection action using .

example.code:
<SfDropDownList TItem="string" TValue="string" DataSource="@MyList">
                <DropDownListEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" OnValueSelect="@OnSelectHandler" />
            </SfDropDownList>
            @code{
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public void OnSelectHandler(SelectEventArgs<string> args) {
                    if(args.ItemData== "Medium")
                        args.Cancel = true;
                }
              }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListFieldSettings
member.summary: A class that represents the Dropdown list fields to map with the data source and binds the data to the component.

example.code:
<SfDropDownList TValue="string" TItem="Country" Placeholder="Select a country" DataSource="@Countries">
                <DropDownListFieldSettings Text="Name" Value="Code"/>
            </SfDropDownList>
            @code{
                public class Country
                {
                    public string Name { get; set; }
                    public string Code { get; set; }
                }
                List<Country> Countries = new List<Country> {
                    new Country() { Name = "Australia", Code = "AU" },
                    new Country() { Name = "Bermuda", Code = "BM" },
                    new Country() { Name = "Canada", Code = "CA" }
                };
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListFieldSettings.GroupBy
member.summary: Gets or sets filed names to display the list in category-wise.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty.

example.code:
<SfDropDownList TValue="string" TItem="Vegetables" Placeholder="Select a country" DataSource="@VegetablesList">
                <DropDownListFieldSettings Text="Name" Value="ID" GroupBy="Category" />
            </SfDropDownList>
            @code{
                public class Vegetables
                {
                    public string ID { get; set; }
                    public string Name { get; set; }
                    public string Category { get; set; }
                }
                List<Vegetables> VegetablesList = new List<Vegetables> {
                    new Vegetables { Name = "Cabbage", Category = "Leafy and Salad", ID = "item1" },
                    new Vegetables { Name = "Chickpea", Category = "Beans", ID = "item2" },
                    new Vegetables { Name = "Green bean", Category = "Beans", ID = "item4" },
                    new Vegetables { Name = "Spinach", Category = "Leafy and Salad", ID = "item9" }
                };
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.UpdateDisableItem(`1)
member.summary: Updates the disabled status of a given item in the list.
member.remarks: This method checks if the given item is not null and if it's not disabled. If so, it sets the disabled field of the item to true. It then updates the item in the ListData and disables the corresponding list item in the ListDataSource. If the item to be disabled is currently selected, it updates the value selection asynchronously.

The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns. When scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the MultiSelect control persists the MultiSelect state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.Fields
member.summary: Gets or sets the `Fields` property of the MultiSelect control that maps the columns of the data table and binds the data to the component. The `Text` property maps the text column from the data table for each list item. The `Value` property maps the value column from the data table for each list item. The `IconCss` property maps the icon class column from the data table for each list item. The `GroupBy` property groups the list items with its related items by mapping the groupBy field.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect control. The placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values: `Never` - never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available; `Always` - the floating label always floats above the MultiSelect; `Auto` - the floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when entering a value in it.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MentionFieldSettings
member.summary: The MentionFieldSettings class is a configuration class that is used to specify which fields in a data source should be used for different aspects of a mention list, For example, you can use this class to specify which fields in a data source should be used for the text and value of each item in the mention list, as well as an optional field for grouping items.
member.remarks: This allows the mention list to be populated with data from the specified data source, making it easier for users to select items from the list. This can be useful in scenarios where users need to select items from a large or complex data set, such as selecting names from a list of contacts or selecting products from a catalog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MentionFieldSettings.GroupBy
member.summary: Gets or sets a field in the data source that should be used for grouping items in the mention list.
member.value: A field in the data source that should be used for grouping items in the mention list. The default value is string.Empty. This is optional and does not have to be specified if you do not want to group items in the mention list. If you do not specify a GroupBy, all items in the mention list will be displayed in a single, ungrouped list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target selector for displaying the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the target element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. This allows users to easily select items from the list of suggestions by typing the mention character and then selecting an item from the list.
member.value: An element on the page should be used as the target for the SfMention component, so that mention component displays suggestion list opens relative to the elements cursor position.
member.remarks: The Target property is required and must be specified.

example.code: @code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the content that has to be passed.
member.value: The value used to build the content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the class/multiple classes separated by a space for the component.
member.value: Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include for popup element. The default value is String.Empty.

example.code: @code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.MentionChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the symbol or single character which triggers the search action in the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character.
member.value: A character of symbol. By default, the trigger character is the @ symbol..

example.code: @code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.ShowMentionChar
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show the along with with the text when displaying selected mention item in target.
member.value: true, the selected mention item displayed along with the mention character. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If ShowMentionChar is set to true, the mention component will display the mention character along with the text of the mentioned item. For example, if the mention character is @ and the user mentions the item "John Doe", the mention will be displayed as @John Doe.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.FilterType
member.summary:
Gets or sets the filter type that specifies the match criteria while searching for mentions. The possible values for the property are:
StartsWith lists the items if the start of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string.
EndsWith lists the items if the end of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string.
Contains lists the items if the item text contains the search term or input string.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies the match criteria while searching. The default value is .

example.code: @code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.AllowSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to continue search action if user enter space after mention character while searching.
member.value: true, the search action takes place even after a space, if the DataSource data's are matched. The default value is false.
member.remarks: By default, the component will only search for mentions when the mention character is immediately followed by a non-whitespace character (e.g. @john but not @ john). However, you can change this behavior and allow the SfMention component to continue searching for mentions even if the user enters a space after the mention character by setting the AllowSpaces property to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.SuffixText
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor.
member.value: Accepts as string value. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: When a item is selected, the component will automatically insert the text of the mentioned item into the target editor. By default, the mention component will insert the text of the mentioned item without any additional text or characters. However, you can specify a custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor.

example.code: @code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.MinLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum length of user input that is required to initiate the search action.
member.value: The minimum number of characters user input that is required to initiate the search action.The default value is 0.
member.remarks: By default, the component will initiate a search as soon as the user begins typing in the editable element. You can change this behavior by setting the property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.Highlight
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to highlight the searched characters on suggestion list items.
member.value: true, enable the highlighting of the searched characters in the suggestions list. The default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the popup's height value in pixels/number/percentage. If a number value is specified, it will be treated as pixels.
member.value: Accepts property accepts a value in pixels, number, or percentage. The default value is 300px.

member.summary: Gets or sets a template that defines how the selected value will be displayed in the editable component. The TItem" is passed as a context to the template, allowing it to access information about the suggested item, such as its and .
member.value: The template content. The default value is null.

example.code: @@@((context as EmployeeData).FirstName) @code{ public class EmployeeData { public string FirstName { get; set; } public string Country { get; set; } } public EmployeeData Data = new EmployeeData(); public Query Query = new Query(); }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectEvents`2.CustomValueSpecifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when custom values (not present in the data source) are selected in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.

example.code:
<SfMultiSelect TValue="int" TItem="Countries" DataSource="@CountryList">
               <MultiSelectEvents TValue="int" TItem="Countries" CustomValueSpecifier="@customValue"/>
               <MultiSelectFieldSettings Text="Name" Value="Code"/>
            </SfMultiSelect>
            @code{
                public class Countries {
                    public string Name { get; set; }
                    public int Code { get; set; }
                }
                private List<Countries> CountryList = new List<Countries>() {
                    new Countries(){ Code= 101, Name= "Australia" },
                    new Countries(){ Code= 102, Name= "Canada" }
                 }
                private void customValue(CustomValueEventArgs<Countries> args) {
                    args.NewData = new Countries() { Code = 103, Name = args.Text };
                }
              }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectEvents`2.DataBound
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the data source is populated in the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectEvents`2.Filtering
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked on typing a character in the MultiSelect Dropdown search box.
member.remarks: Prevent the default filter action and make your query enable the event argument, and pass the modified data source and query in the method.

example.code:
<SfMultiSelect @ref="MultiSelectObj" TItem="string" TValue="string" AllowFiltering="true" DataSource="@MyList">
                <MultiSelectEvents TValue="string" TItem="string" Filtering="@OnFilteringHandler" />
            </SfMultiSelect>
            @code{
                SfMultiSelect<string, string> MultiSelectObj { get; set; }
                protected List<string> MyList = new List<string>() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" };
                public async Task OnFilteringHandler(FilteringEventArgs args) {
                    args.PreventDefaultAction = true;
                    var query = new Query().Where(new WhereFilter() { Field = "Text", Operator = "contains", value = args.Text, IgnoreCase = true });
                    await MultiSelectObj.FilterAsync(MyList, query);
                }
              }
